intro: Pulsatilla vulgaris var. costeana, commonly known as the European pasqueflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its showy, early spring blooms that are typically pale yellow to pinkish in color. The plant has a short, thick rhizome and produces a basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are borne on tall, naked pedicels and are often visited by pollinators such as bees. The species is adapted to calcareous soils and thrives in open, sunny habitats.
